ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English `stock` (referring to the leg or lower part of the body), plus the suffix `-ing`.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A close-fitting, stretchable covering for the foot and lower part of the leg, often extending to the thigh or waist, typically worn by women.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种紧身、有弹性的覆盖脚和腿部（常延伸至大腿或腰部）的衣物，通常为女性穿着。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She wore silk stockings with her vintage dress.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她穿着丝袜搭配她的复古连衣裙。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large sock or bag hung up by children on Christmas Eve for Santa Claus to fill with presents.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 圣诞前夜孩子们挂起来的、等待圣诞老人装礼物的长袜子或袋子。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The children eagerly hung their stockings by the fireplace.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 孩子们焦急地把圣诞袜挂在壁炉旁。
